channel.title: #181: Conducting customer interviews for the reluctant, with Asia Orangio of DemandMaven
channel.description:
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/0b1d5fb1-d06a-4cfb-8c97-0b9c349d9953?dark=false"></iframe>
@peldi continues this mini-season as he chats with Asia Orangio of [DemandMaven](https://demandmaven.io/) on how founders can - and should - conduct customer interviews, and how to deal with the discomfort us bootstrappers often feel with this type of work.
Topics includes
* the discomfort for some of us of talking to customers - but why you should do it anyway * how to find the right customers to talk to * why delegating customer interviews might actually be a good idea. * how to actually conduct a customer interview * what not to say, and how not to ask questions
Asia's company, [DemandMaven](https://demandmaven.io/).
[Asia on Twitter](https://twitter.com/AsiaOrangio).
You can [watch this episode on YouTube](https://youtu.be/B3o4OB9_Ocs).
